analyzed: dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The Chapter on the Conditions for Phenomena

original: Navipākaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca vipāko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Navipākaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca vipākadhammadhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … pañca.
analyzed: na vipākam dhammam paṭicca vipākaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na vipākam dhammam paṭicca vipāka dhamma dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā pañca
translated: With a non-resultant phenomenon as condition, a resultant phenomenon arises, a condition by way of condition being a condition. With a non-resultant phenomenon as condition, a phenomenon that is neither resultant nor a condition arises, a condition by way of condition being a condition. … five.

original: Navipākadhammadhammaṁ paṭicca vipāko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Navipākadhammadhammaṁ paṭicca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … tīṇi.🔽Nanevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paṭicca nevavipākanavipākadhammadhammo uppajjati
analyzed: na vipāka dhamma dhammam paṭicca vipākaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na vipāka dhamma dhammam paṭicca neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā tīṇi  na neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paṭicca neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ uppajjati
translated: With a phenomenon that is neither resultant nor a condition as condition, a resultant phenomenon arises, a condition by way of condition being a condition. With a phenomenon that is neither resultant nor a condition as condition, a phenomenon that is neither resultant nor a condition arises, a condition by way of condition being a condition. … three.

original: hetupaccayā. Nanevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paṭicca vipāko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā🔽… pañca. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: hetu paccayā na neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paṭicca vipākaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā 🔽pañca saṅkhitta
translated: With a phenomenon that is neither resultant nor a condition as condition, a phenomenon that is neither resultant nor a condition arises, a condition by way of decisive support condition … a condition by way of object condition … a condition by way of predominance condition … a condition by way of support condition … a condition by way of association condition … a condition by way of presence condition … a condition by way of non-disappearance condition … a condition by way of root condition … a condition by way of prenascence condition … a condition by way of postnascence condition … a condition by way of arising before condition … a condition by way of arising together condition … a condition by way of nutriment condition … a condition by way of faculty condition … a condition by way of absorption condition … a condition by way of path condition … a condition by way of association condition … a condition by way of presence condition … a condition by way of non-disappearance condition … a condition by way of root condition … a condition by way of prenascence condition … a condition by way of postnascence condition … a condition by way of arising before condition … a condition by way of arising together condition … a condition by way of nutriment condition … a condition by way of faculty condition … a condition by way of absorption condition … a condition by way of path condition … a condition by way of association condition … a condition by way of presence condition … a condition by way of non-disappearance condition … a condition by way of root condition … a condition by way of prenascence condition … a condition by way of postnascence condition … a condition by way of arising before condition … a condition by way of arising together condition … a condition by way of nutriment condition … a condition by way of faculty condition … a condition by way of absorption

original: Hetuyā dvāvīsa, ārammaṇe ekādasa, adhipatiyā aṭṭhārasa …pe… aññamaññe soḷasa …pe… purejāte nava, āsevane cha …pe… vipāke pannarasa …pe… avigate dvāvīsa.
analyzed: hetuyā dvāvīsa ārammaṇe ekādasa adhipatiyā aṭṭhārasa pe aññamaññe soḷasa pe purejāte nava āsevane cha pe vipāke pannarasa pe avigate dvāvīsa
translated: In the case of the cause, there are twenty-two; in the case of the object, eleven; in the case of the predominance, eighteen … in the case of the prenascence, nine; in the case of the repetition, six … in the case of the kamma result, fifteen … in the case of the unincluded, twenty-two.
